example[0]: Wheeled conveyances of any kind are not allowed in the park.
definition[1]: when you take something from one place to another
definition[2]: when you communicate or express something, with or without words
example[2]: Facial expressions are part of the conveyance of meaning.
definition[3]: a legal document that gives land, property etc to one person from another
definition[4]: a document that officially states that land or property has passed from one person to another
example[3]: the drafting of a legal document such as a will or a conveyance
definition[5]: when land or property that was owned by one person becomes the property of another person, or the legal process involved in doing this
example[4]: the conveyance of a legal estate to new trustees
